intro: Gayophytum diffusum subsp. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered gayophytum, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features soft, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are small, pale pink to white, and typically appear in clusters. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
